cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles WNW of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: continues northwest through the Bahamas and is forecast to approach the southeast Florida coast, then turn northward along the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Florida coast (around Broward-Palm Beach counties)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet (includes Port Everglades area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for the Northwestern Bahamas (none yet for Florida)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coastline from Miami-Dade through Palm Beach counties and the Northwestern/Central Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50+ mph) possible late Saturday into early Sunday; a low (8%) chance of sustained 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <3 ft) and dangerous surf/rip currents expected along the Broward coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 2–4 inches with local totals near or above 4 inches causing urban/flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous marine conditions for harbor operations and possible short-period port closure as the storm passes.
